00019 #ifndef _LIBGETTEXT_H
00020 #define _LIBGETTEXT_H 1
00021 
00022 /* NLS can be disabled through the configure --disable-nls option.  */
00023 #if ENABLE_NLS
00024 
00025 /* Get declarations of GNU message catalog functions.  */
00026 # include <libintl.h>
00027 
00028 #else
00029 
00030 /* Solaris /usr/include/locale.h includes /usr/include/libintl.h, which
00031    chokes if dcgettext is defined as a macro.  So include it now, to make
00032    later inclusions of <locale.h> a NOP.  We don't include <libintl.h>
00033    as well because people using "gettext.h" will not include <libintl.h>,
00034    and also including <libintl.h> would fail on SunOS 4, whereas <locale.h>
00035    is OK.  */
00036 #if defined(__sun)
00037 # include <locale.h>
00038 #endif
00039 
00040 /* Disabled NLS.
00041    The casts to 'const char *' serve the purpose of producing warnings
00042    for invalid uses of the value returned from these functions.
00043    On pre-ANSI systems without 'const', the config.h file is supposed to
00044    contain "#define const".  */
00045 # define gettext(Msgid) ((const char *) (Msgid))
00046 # define dgettext(Domainname, Msgid) ((const char *) (Msgid))
00047 # define dcgettext(Domainname, Msgid, Category) ((const char *) (Msgid))
00048 # define ngettext(Msgid1, Msgid2, N) \
00049     ((N) == 1 ? (const char *) (Msgid1) : (const char *) (Msgid2))
00050 # define dngettext(Domainname, Msgid1, Msgid2, N) \
00051     ((N) == 1 ? (const char *) (Msgid1) : (const char *) (Msgid2))
00052 # define dcngettext(Domainname, Msgid1, Msgid2, N, Category) \
00053     ((N) == 1 ? (const char *) (Msgid1) : (const char *) (Msgid2))
00054 # define textdomain(Domainname) ((const char *) (Domainname))
00055 # define bindtextdomain(Domainname, Dirname) ((const char *) (Dirname))
00056 # define bind_textdomain_codeset(Domainname, Codeset) ((const char *) (Codeset))
00057 
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 /* A pseudo function call that serves as a marker for the automated
00061    extraction of messages, but does not call gettext().  The run-time
00062    translation is done at a different place in the code.
00063    The argument, String, should be a literal string.  Concatenated strings
00064    and other string expressions won't work.
00065    The macro's expansion is not parenthesized, so that it is suitable as
00066    initializer for static 'char[]' or 'const char[]' variables.  */
00067 #define gettext_noop(String) String
00068 
00069 #endif /* _LIBGETTEXT_H */
